required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of the Efficacy of Biologics vs Usual Treatment on OCS Reduction for Severe Asthma Patients Using Health Insurance Claim Database
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of the Efficacy of Biologics vs Usual Treatment on OCS Reduction for Severe Asthma Patients Using Health Insurance Claim Database

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a retrospective cohort study of patients diagnosed with asthma based on the data extracted from the MDV database. The study period is from 1st Jun 2016 to 29th February 2020 .

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage reduction on daily dose of maintenance OCS from week-0 to week-24
Percentage of patients who achieved >0%, ≥25%, ≥50%, 100% OCS reduction of daily maintenance OCS dose from week-0 to week-24 respectively.
primary_outcome.description: (the number of patients who achieved >0%, ≥25%, ≥50%, 100% OCS reduction of daily maintenance OCS dose) / (number of total patients ) x 100

primary_outcome.measure: Total amount of maintenance OCS prescribed during outcome period.
primary_outcome.time_frame: from index date to 24 weeks later

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage reduction on daily dose of maintenance OCS from week-0 to week-24 with two groups.
primary_outcome.description: Two groups are amount of regular OCS use at index date is ①5mg/day or more and ②10mg/day or more respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Total amount of SCS during outcome period.
primary_outcome.time_frame: from index date to 24 weeks later

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of OCS reduction of maintenance OCS dose from week-0 to week-8.
Percentage of OCS reduction of maintenance OCS dose from week-0 to week-16.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage reduction on daily dose of maintenance OCS from week-0 to week-24 between benralizumab or mepolizumab initiated severe asthma patients with regular maintenance OCS use and BIO non-initiated severe asthma patients with regular.
Total amount of maintenance OCS prescribed during one year and two years respectively.
other_outcome.time_frame: during one year and two years

other_outcome.measure: Total amount of SCS during one year and two year respectively.
other_outcome.time_frame: during one year and two years

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with an exacerbation during outcome period.
other_outcome.time_frame: from index date to 24 weeks later

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with no exacerbation during outcome period.
other_outcome.time_frame: from index date to 24 weeks later
from index date to 24 weeks later

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who used asthma related medication during baseline period and outcome period respectively.
other_outcome.time_frame: during baseline period and outcome period

other_outcome.measure: The total canisters of SABA prescribed during baseline period and outcome period respectively.
other_outcome.time_frame: during baseline period and outcome period

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who received high dose ICS or high dose ICS/LABA during outcome period.
other_outcome.time_frame: from index date to 24 week later

study_pop.textblock: All individuals who meet followed inclusion / exclusion criteria will be identified between study period in the MDV database, and will be included in Full Analysis Set.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients aged ≥16 years at index date.
2. Patients with records of receiving high dose ICS or high dose ICS/LABA and diagnosed as asthma (ICD-10 code: J45 or J46 ) during baseline period. High dose ICS and high dose ICS/LABA will be defined in the appendices (Table 6-9).
3. Patients who had visit histories at least one visit during baseline period, at least two visits during outcome period and at least one visit after outcome period.
4. Patients who had a total of 12 weeks of OCS prescribed during the baseline period including the index date.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients diagnosed with selected autoimmune diseases during the baseline period because OCS is used as a therapeutic agent for these disease. Autoimmune disease will be identified by following ICD-10 code (M30, M05, M06, L93, M32, K50, K51, K52, N04).

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers can request access to anonymized individual patient-level data from AstraZeneca group of companies sponsored clinical trials/studies via the request portal. All request will be evaluated as per the AZ disclosure commitment: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure. Yes, indicates that AZ are accepting requests for IPD, but this does not mean all requests will be shared.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: AstraZeneca will meet or exceed data availability as per the commitments made to the EFPIA Pharma Data Sharing Principles. For details of our timelines, please rerefer to our disclosure commitment at https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: When a request has been approved AstraZeneca will provide access to the de-identified individual patient-level data in an approved sponsored tool . Signed Data Sharing Agreement (non-negotiable contract fordata accessors) must be in place before accessing requested information. Additionally, all users will need to accept the terms and conditions of the SAS MSE to gain access. For additional details, please review the Disclosure Statements at https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure.
